The Supreme Court of the United States serves as the highest judicial body in the federal court system, interpreting the Constitution and making final judgments on cases appealed from lower courts. The Supreme Court of the United States has jurisdiction over the entire nation and interprets the Constitution, whereas the High Courts of Justice in Spain deal specifically with regional matters and are part of a more decentralized judicial structure.
